zendesk_articles.title: When is a Police Report Required for a Claim?
zendesk_articles.body:
A police report is REQUIRED when filing a claim for:

- Theft (vehicle stolen) - Vandalism (vehicle keyed, broken into, or damaged intentionally) - Hit and Run (other driver left the scene) - Any accident involving injuries

If your claim involves any of these situations and you do not have a police report number, your claim will be placed on hold until you can provide one.
zendesk_articles.snippet: A police report is REQUIRED when filing a claim for: - Theft (vehicle stolen) - Vandalism (vehicle keyed, broken into, or damaged intentionally) -...

zendesk_articles.title: Vehicles We Cannot Insure
zendesk_articles.body:
The following vehicles cannot be added to a personal auto policy:

**Excluded Makes (all models):** - Ferrari, Lamborghini, McLaren, Bugatti

**Excluded Specific Models:** - Dodge Viper, Challenger Hellcat, Challenger Demon - Chevrolet Corvette Z06, Corvette ZR1 - Ford Mustang Shelby GT500

**Also Excluded:** - Vehicles with salvage or rebuilt titles - Vehicles used for rideshare (Uber, Lyft) or commercial delivery
zendesk_articles.snippet: The following vehicles cannot be added to a personal auto policy: **Excluded Makes (all models):** - Ferrari, Lamborghini, McLaren, Bugatti...

zendesk_articles.title: Removing a Vehicle with an Open Claim
zendesk_articles.body:
A vehicle cannot be removed from your policy while it has an open claim.

Open claim stages include: - Initial Review - Investigation - Repair/Recovery - Settlement

Once your claim reaches a Closed status (Paid, Denied, or Withdrawn), you may request to remove the vehicle.
zendesk_articles.snippet: A vehicle cannot be removed from your policy while it has an open claim. Open claim stages include: - Initial Review - Investigation -...

zendesk_articles.title: Removing a Named Insured or Co-Insured
zendesk_articles.body:
A Named Insured or Co-Insured cannot simply be removed from the policy. This requires a contract change.

Situations that require a contract change: - Divorce or separation - One party moving out of household - Ownership transfer of insured vehicles

Please contact us to discuss your specific situation. These requests are handled by our policy services team.
zendesk_articles.snippet: A Named Insured or Co-Insured cannot simply be removed from the policy. This requires a contract change. Situations that require a contract change: -...

zendesk_articles.title: Payment Arrangement Limits
zendesk_articles.body:
The number of payment arrangements you can receive per year depends on your customer tier:

- **Standard:** 1 arrangement per 12 months - **Preferred:** 2 arrangements per 12 months - **Premium:** 3 arrangements per 12 months

Arrangement types include extensions and installment plans.
zendesk_articles.snippet: The number of payment arrangements you can receive per year depends on your customer tier: - **Standard:** 1 arrangement per 12 months -...

zendesk_articles.title: Policy Cancellation Notice Requirements
zendesk_articles.body:
Minimum notice required for policy cancellation depends on your state:

**California & New York:** Cancellation date must be at least 1 day in the future. Same-day cancellation is not allowed.

**Texas & Florida:** Same-day cancellation is allowed. Your policy can be cancelled effective today.
zendesk_articles.snippet: Minimum notice required for policy cancellation depends on your state: **California & New York:** Cancellation date must be at least 1 day in the...

zendesk_articles.title: Policy Reinstatement Windows
zendesk_articles.body:
If your policy was cancelled for non-payment, you may be able to reinstate it within these timeframes:

- **Standard customers:** 15 days from cancellation date - **Preferred customers:** +15 additional days - **Premium customers:** +30 additional days.
